I don't seem to have any side effects others complained about but did notice Victoza did curb my hunger better. Truicity seems to make me nauseous after about 15 minutes of eating a large meal? Victoza kinda made me feel nauseous and not want to eat. As i'm insulin resistant i'm all alot meds like 30mg Actos, 2000mg Metformin, 2mg Glimepiride daily.  The doctor has lowered my Novolin N morning injection from 120 units to 70 and evening injections from 80 units to 30 because of my lower glucose numbers. I've had several low glucose events both day and nightly and i go back the 26th of this month for a A1-C to see about adjusting my meds.

After the 2nd weekly dose, I had a bad case of gout in my lfeft foot. Also, all my joints were hurting me 10 times worse than usual. I also noticed that I was having wierd thoughts. I stopped taking it after the third week. It has been two weeks now since I stopped taking it and I feel almost back to normal.
Horrible nausea. Constipation. Had to stop using it.  It was moderately effecting at reducing blood glucose, but how much of that was because I was hardly eating anything.
Started having palpitations with this med. severe hoarseness and difficulty swallowing. Chest pains daily. Had to stop taking this med.
Love the results of this medication just wish there was some way to reduce the injection pain.
Horrible gastric issues , heartburn, reflux and severe  bloating.

I've been on this now for about 3 months. My morning fasting blood sugars have been higher since I started with an average now of 183. I'll be taking another A1C this week and expect it will increase. Previously it was at 7.3 but I was on another weekly injection. Hopefully my doctor will change or modify my treatment.

My sugar levels went from the 200's to normal. There have been some lows because I had to adjust my Novalog down with meals. I don't need half the novalog I use to. My only complaint is the 10 seconds of pain when injecting. Wow, it hurts. No weight loss, but at least sugar levels are almost cut in half, and no big highs since I started. It's been 5 weeks and no side effects. I think this is a great drug.

HYPOGLYCEMIA is not an issue with me so the medication gets all 5-Stars from me.  My blood sugar has gone from the mid 200's to 150 every morning.  It works well with Jardiance and metformin.  I'm on the 1.5 dose and nausea is not an issue.  Weight loss is also much easier with these drugs, which helps lower the readings too.    Great drugs by Eli Lilly and the insurance company recommended them to me, as cost effective treatment.  They got that right and I am in.

from week one worked to get my blood sugar down first few days did not feel well at all stayed with it dr and insurance co wanted me to try it longer long story short blood pressure sky high had ekg showed inferior wall MI had Catherization lucky no damage don't use this crap insurance co made them out me back on Victoza yay or I was going to sue them

I am a person with Type 1 and started to use this drug 3 weeks ago to help with weight loss. The first week I had a very mild upset stomach, but nothign some ginger-ale couldn't fix.  I have so far had no other side effects.  I feel full, not bloated.  I find I have been eating more slowly, and feel full faster.  No bloat (not to be confused with feeling full). No pains, nothing else.  I have shed a few pounds but not sure if it's a result of the things I just wrote, or else.  But, I look forward to seeing what happens.

This is the beginning of my 4th week. My blood sugar was almost impossible for me to get below 150 prior to starting Trulicity. exactly 1 week after starting my blood sugar was perfect! 30 day average of 138, 14 day average 128. I have been in touch with myself to find any kind of side effect. I have not been able to find one. I am so happy!
A1c from 770 to 620 over 6month period

Started with small dose injection. Blood sugar went from 170/180 to 250/275 almost immediately.Doctor changed dose to larger dose injection. Blood sugar climbed again. I also felt real bad and had issues with my legs and balance. Stopped the injections and went back to orals. Blood sugar now in the 135/155 range. I WILL NOT USE THIS MEDICATION AGAIN.

I have been on this drug for 5 weeks.  It has worked really well at lowering my numbers from morning high of 130 to 80's.  I reduced my Lantus from 35mg X2/day to 10 once a day.  I do have the nausea and vomiting for the first couple days after the injection each week.  However, the biggest issue that I have had is sever constipation! I went from normal daily BM's to once a week!  I tried every trick in the book, Meralax, stool softeners 4/a day, drinking 90oz of water, more fiber, etc. you name it I tried it.  My doctor has stopped the drug for a month to see if I return to normal functions.
works wonderfully..sugar is in control with metformin

This is my third week.  I took the low dose the first two weeks and the higher dose this week.  Reading the reviews definitely scared me.  I haven't had a single problem.  I get very slightly nauseous for about five minutes after the shot, then I'm fine.  My blood sugar is wonderful.  The lower dose didn't effect my appetite, but the higher dose does.  This is not a negative!  I did notice that the lower dose wore off the day before the next shot.  I'm curious to see if the higher dose does the same.  In all, I'm very surprised that it works so well.
No energy, No appetite.  Did lower sugars, couldn't tolerate the side effects

Started Trulicity October 2015. A1C was 12 and had finally gotten Lantus fro 50 to 10. In addition, also take metformin 2000mg per day. Along with diet and exercise (cardio, weight training, ect), my A1C is now at 6 and I am off the Lantus. I started on the .75 dose for 2 weeks before moving to 1.5. Nausea was initially fairly mild but persistent for first 3 weeks. After that, no problem. Definitely kills the appetite. I was practicing portion control and found I eat even less. Psychologically, it pains me to have to take medication, but this is what is needed for now and is working. I try to think of it as a tool. My goal is to be medication free.

I took trulicity since June 2015 after spending a week in the hospital for an infections cysit and was on IV drugs. Blood sugars in the 350  range. Five injections of isulin (3 of Novalog,2 of Levimire). Were ineffective. Last ditch effort by my doctor was to try Trulicity.  Overnight blood sugars went to 116. Stayed low after each weeks injection. A1C went from 13 to 7. No real bad side effects,loss of appetite, major weight loss after 6 months (60  lbs.) Stopped taking on my own 50 days ago without doctors knowledge, Blood sugars leveled out to high 110s to 120s
The drug from hell....severe nausea, mega headaches, vomiting.  I wii not take another injection

Just started and on second dose, within days I becgn to gain weight a pound every day. I noticed my legs were swollen and they felt thick and heavy, I also felt hyper. Second shot 8th day swelling in hands and eyes now too, so I called doctor and now moving onto Tanzeum. If your not allergic, it did a wonderful job of stopping hunger. Good Luck!

I have taken for 2 months. I am mostly satisfied. Less urination than invokana. I have mild lower back pain. Overall I feel pretty good. Sugars are down to low 100's in morning and low 140's after lunch. I take .75 mg weekly, with 2000 mg metformin daily. Jury is still out but no severe side effects and energy ok. I do have a weird metallic taste after eating? I lost weight on invokana but it sapped my energy. So far weight is stable on trulicity and a1c is 6.6.

My first injection on Friday...sick stomach and diarrhea on Sunday. All of that lasted the entire week. Second injection on Friday, sick stomach and indigestion on Sunday. On Tuesday, I felt human again, everything back to normal. I'm eating half of a meal instead of the whole thing and I'm not craving anything. I have lost weight and am feeling so much better. For anyone skeptical about this, please at least give it a try...may take a couple of weeks to level out, but it's worth it!

1st injection Wed, vomiting by Fri.. second injection following Thur (so as not to miss work again) sick Sun.. 3rd injection thur.. giving it one more chance.. fasting 160 down from 200.. no weight loss, terrible bloat.. retaining fluid in hands. Nausea worse if I eat..I try not to eat for couple days after shot don't understand why no weight loss.. I see new endo dr in Jan, hope I can continue with this med till then..

On drugs.com the truth about this horrible medicine is there. 38 reviews about vomitimg, nausea, stomach pain, bloating, and the runs. These side affects put people in the hospital and I will no let my husband take it.

I'm not sure what is happening but my vision it's hard to focus since I've taken my second shot it's hard to drive because I cannot focus when I look down has anybody else had this kind of side effect with this medication I went to the eye doctor he gave me an eye exam my vision is 20 20 there is no explanation for the vision problems that I am having the only new medication I've been taking is trulicity.

I have been on this drug for 2 months. It wipes out your appetite altogether. And I found it difficult to force myself to eat. I haven't felt any relief from diabetic foot/nerve pain. But my glucose levels have been low; below 100 in the mornings and no higher than 140 at night. I do take this weekly along with my nightly insulin. I was hesitant at first about why I needed to try this, but if you can deal with the no appetite and tiredness; it works.

This medication dropped my sugar from 300-475 down to the low 100's -150 depending on the time of day. I've lost 24lbs in three months. I've had extreme fatigue but it's worth it. I don't have as much nerve pain as I did, and I can almost feel my fingertips again. Lack of appetite is amazing, I eat because I have to not because I want to. The pen is another huge plus. Needles give me anxiety, but this I can handle.
Used for a month so far.  My fasting blood sugar level has went from way over 300 to under 100.  Have also lost weight.  I have not experienced the side effects some have.

Wish I had been warned about the side effects. My readings have dropped from 235 - 255 to 170 on 1st day to now on 6th day to 140. However it has felt like a war going on in my body, fever, sick, tired etc. I have been in bed since day 2 and cannot see any end to this. Do I take my 2nd dose?
Had all the side effects, not good, way too much pain!!!
the side effects make me miserable it keeps my numbers down I am not happy with the way I feel

I love this. It has not only brought down my readings from 300 and 400 to 130 and lower, but my weight has dropped from 230 to 195. I do experience low readings due to lack of wanting food. But I have set alarms that remind me to eat. I have only one side effect and that is some burping sometimes. I can live with this. Love, Love, Love.  P.S. My A1C is way down too...9 down to 6.8. doing great, am due another A1C this month.

I've been on Trulicity for a week now.  No nausea, no cravings, no bad side effects as of yet.  I'm not as hungry. While testing my sugar, it seems to be working awesomely.  I go back in 2 months for blood work.  I have also lost 6 lbs in the first week.  This is the only med for diabetics to help me.
the side effects are miserable but it does bring down my numbers.

This drug helped me to lose 5 lbs in one week. It controls my sweet tooth and evens out my sugars because I no longer feel the shakes when I don't eat on time but I still get headaches sometimes. I am happy with the outcome.

I have been using it for almost 6 months now. I have lost considerable amount of weight. Glucose levels are down very well. A1C down to 5.4 from 7.8. I use it with Metformin. I was on Bydureon previously it caused me a lot of bumps and skin reactions. Trulicity is a blessing and the ease of use is great!

Frist week on the pen. It seems great I am not having that craving for sweets. I don't feel as hungry. I believe it's going to be great. My blood sugars are down from 200 to 130's. Will get back in 3 months when I do the A1C.

I had been on Victoza but couldn't continue because of the nausea.  I was also taking Lantus.  I started on Trulicity two weeks ago and had no nausea, have more energy and my blood sugars are in range.  I no longer take lentos either.
I loved Victoza. It helped with hungry control too. Unfortunately my insurance won’t cover it and I can’t pay over $600/month.

Was told to start at .6 for two weeks. Started at .3 to check for allergies.  That has made me so sick and nauseated I am going back to .1 and will try to work up to a decent size dose,but its going to take a while.  Injecting was way less painful than testing blood sugar
It seems to have caused insomnia and can't get to sleep before 4am

I have taking 1.2 dose of victoza for a year now, I was taking junuvia but it didn't do nothing for me and metforim gave me a severe diarrhea so my dr. switched me to lantus and victoza I'm very happy with the victoza I've had no side effects and I've lost 53 pounds in the last year

I was totally satisfied while taking Victoza. My A1c was staying around 6.1. It also kept my weight down.  Unfortunately after 2 years it had caused my Liver Function levels to elevate and go out of range and I had to come off of it.  It is very sad and stressful since now I have to try something new.
I have been taking this for 2 months at the 1.2 dose. I have not had any side effects at all. I have lost weight and my numbers are good. I can't wait to find out what my A1C is!

Diabetic for 23 years and in insulin with oral medications to.  Gained weight constantly unable to lose.  Than, on Nov 2015 I was taken off insulin because of extreme low blood sugars.   Continue with ActosPlusMetormin 3 X day, highest dose.  Tuesday June 21,2016 decrease to 2 pills a day getting lower blood sugar   Just taking Victoza since May 2014 it had help to achieve coming off insulin and losing 70 pounds   I am so happy with the results using Victoza, hadn't known about not injecting my 2 X day and now no insulin.

I was diagnosed with polycystic ovarian syndrome (POS) years ago. Last year, I was referred to a doctor that specializes in this disease; at the time I first met him, I weighed a whopping 387 pounds (I’m 5’10’’). Of course, the first thing he told me was that my POS would get better if I lost weight. I was totally discouraged! I told him that I was very active and had been on EVERY diet… nothing seemed to work. I was so frustrated and asked if there was anything he could do to jump start my weight loss from a medical stand point. This is when he told me about Victoza and about the study that demonstrated that individuals suffering from POS, not from Type 2 diabetes had lost weight on this medication but there were some serious side effects to consider. I was so desperate that after reading on the matter for a few days, I decided to try it out. The first months were pretty horrible because I had severe nausea and vomiting (in the morning upon waking I would throw up stomach acid – I know erk!) but I decided to continue. The reason I kept up with it is that, for the first time in my life, I could sense that I was full when I ate. For some reason, this message was not making its way up to my brain when I ate before… I thought it was awesome. The medication no only killed every craving I normally had but it stopped me from overeating. I have been on Victoza for one year now. The side effects are no longer there (they stopped after about 6 months after starting Victoza) and I now weigh 276 pounds… yes I lost over 100 pounds. I am continuing to lose weight and wish you all the best.
Acute pancreatic reaction with non-stop vomiting and diarrhea..taking over 24 hours to recover

I started on 0.6 a week and worked my way up to 1.8 a week. I haven't had any bad side effects with this medication. No nausea, no sickness. I did have a slight headache the very first week I started. It hasn't help me lose any weight but it has kept my blood sugar under control.

Was on 4 oral medications for my diabetes, and after several years of good control, my numbers started to increase. Started Victoza and even before moving up to 1.28 dose, my numbers immediately dropped about 30 pts,and I lost about 7 lbs in first week. Only side effects were some minor nausea, and a couple days of diarrhea,but both passed after a week or so. The sugar control remains good (averaging about 110) but unfortunately the weight loss stopped. The dosages for my oral medications have dropped, and some may be eliminated. My medicare advantage plan only provides partial coverage (tier II drug)but the drug is worth it. Of course, I hope I never develop the more serious long-term side effects, but the long-term side effects of uncontrolled diabetes are pretty bad also.
I want to thank God for my Dr. Iam pre diabeta, been on Victoza for 9 days loss 9lbs. I could not lose any weight.The only side affect, I am never hungry.

Hello. I heard some great things about victoza and some really bad things so I decided to try it out and hope for the best. Sad to say that I simply couldn't stand all the side effects that I encountered while on it. I felt like I was in a daze all the time and the nausea was really bad. I completely lost my appetite and after a week I started to throw up multiple times a day. I decided to stop because it simply made me sick to my stomach. I did some research on the internet to try and find something over the counter without side effects. I found this supplement called cinnalife which so far has been amazing for me. My A1C has significantly dropped which i'm sure is a large part due to the energy that this supplement gives me. I have been very active since I started taking them. Anyways, just wanted to share that there are always alternatives to these injectables with these horrible side effects. I have heard that there are some new injectables out in the market, but I'm simply too scared to try them =(
not sure if I have to eat before or after I give my injection.

i have been taken victoza for a lil over 2 months now and i have lost 22lbs my a1 is where it needs to be and my sugar levels are in a good rage the only down side to me using this is i have sever joint pain from head to toe about once a week or once every 2 weeks im not sure if anyone has this same problem or not but i really do not like it at all i have to stay in bed all day and it hurts so bad if someone touches me or i have to move other than that it works great.
For those who cannot afford Victoza, go to Victoza website and get coupon to never pay more than $25.  That's what I did'

The Victoza did help decrease my blood sugar numbers nadmy A1C, but I had a massive amount of side effects that I didn't know was being increased by the Victoza because the Victoza was started around the same time that I was also having gallbladder issues, and had a gall stone. After my gallbladder removal I remained sick with the same symptoms I had prior to it of: heartburn, nausea, vomiting, epigastric pain, severe foul smelling belching, and gas. This continued for some time, and my doctor decided to remove me off my Victoza because my diabetes #'s, and A1C were getting to a level of satisfaction for her.   I remained off my Victoza for about a month, and my blood sugar numbers began to gradually creep up again, so my doctor decided to put me back on it.   I had finally became free of the side effects listed above, but still not relating them to the Victoza.  Then my wife, who is a RN said the she was getting ready to give me a Victoza injection, and wanted me to let her know if any of the symptoms that I'd had for so long returned.  Within 30 mins of receiving the Victoza injection I again started having foul smelling belching, gas, and began vomiting profusely.    Victoza is an awesome drug, and does what it's suppose to do.  I'd recommend it to anyone who is able to take it, but if you have anything weird start happening within your body once you start taking it, you can bet money that the Victoza Will be what's causing it.

Don't even start taking this! I took Victoza for ten months. I feel like I have lost ten months of my life. It started with diarrhia, vomiting. I just felt yuck all day. then the hives started. I've gone to the hospital four times in ten months. That doesn't even include hives that didn't send me to the ER.  So everyday feeling not great, the last trip to the ER was in a ambulance because the reaction caused me to pass out. I lost a little weight, but when you are always nausea and diarrhea and vomiting, of course you will loose weight. I feel like I was a guinia pig with this drug. Just stay away from it, it was life changing. After not taking it for three weeks now, I feel so much better. Not even a stomach ache!!!

Began with such hope, but turned to nausea day 1, tired & lack of energy. The next few days went to nausea, bloating, stomach cramps, etc. affected my ability to work for several days. Then hit the 6th day nausea, bloating, vomiting and diarrhea began. I'm done. I lost 9 lbs, but it is NOT worth it.

Am a 71-yr-old male., and on 1000mg Metformin, 5mg Farxiga, and 1.8mg Victoza daily.  Been taking Victoza for 10 months.  Almost immediately lost 10 lbs to a comfortable 200 lbs (6'4").  A1C dropped from 6.7 to about 6.1. Morning glucose readings run 105-120.  Seems to be working great, but concerned about long-term side effects.  Still, high sugar levels are known to do much damage long term, so plan to stay with what's now working.
Side effects experieced is many sour stomachs with gas bloating,so tired, I'm on 2 months lots of nausia, not able to continue on this drug, just not for me.
Works great but giving me violent hiccups :( both at 0.6 and 1.2 dose.

I was given Victoza by my diabetes specialist for my type 2 diabetes as he hoped it would help me lose weight. I am also taking insulin.  However, my nausea turned quickly to vomiting and dizziness.  I continued in the hope these symptoms would go away.  I was certainly losing weight but at great cost.  Finally, I was so weak I had to be rushed to the emergency room.  I was severely dehydrated and my blood pressure was so low the doctor there put me on intravenous fluids. AS soon as I stopped the Victoza I began to feel better and am now feeling pretty ok.  Dizziness, dehydration and extreme low blood pressure went away. Just as well, because right before all this, I had gone to the drug store to fill my prescription for Victoza (till then my doctor had given me samples) and I found out it was going to cost $600 to fill!  Needless to say, I can´t afford this.  I live on social security and a small pension.

Sugar dropped like a rock. Run 70-90. Lost about 15 lbs. Side effects- constipation, "sour stomach" belching. Feel like food sits in stomach for hours.  If low sugar occurs, eating or drinking doesn't help.  Just have to suspend insulin pump and hope for the best.

Love this med!  Down 40 lbs. so far and was able to come off Metformin.  BG has stabilized even more since I'm off the Metformin!  Be sure to use the tiny "nano" needles, I don't even feel them. A1C was 5.6!

This has been like a wonder drug for me. Besides no appitite. Makes it difficult to eat when you know you have to but there is no desire.  Lost weight and A1C is impressive.Tried Byetta first and thought I was slowly dieing from the side effects this one has not done that to me.

I have been on this medication starting my 3rd week--I have lost 7 pounds and feel full when eating very little. Have had some minor headaches and nausea, when this happens I eat a couple of crackers and it goes away. They just increased my dosage to 1.8 will see what happen next. Sugars have been okay. But I like it so far.
i fill full all the time is this soppose to happen

I've been on Victoza for 2 months. My blood sugars are good and I've been able to eliminate glyburide and cut my insulin from 25 units twice a day to 10 twice a day. I've been able to follow a diet and eat less and have lost 24 lbs so far.
It lowered mu A1c considerably. I lost 10 lbs., then no more. The only thing I don't like is the high cost. After 3 mos. I'm in the donut hole already & have to pay over $600. for a 3 mo. supply.
The drug works great, but it cost me $1,000 for a 90 day supply until you meet your ins deductible.

I have had type 2 diabetes for 15 years.  Have had no side effects in the 5 months I've been using Victoza.  Unfortunately, has not been effective at all; glucose readings remain the same.  Will be discussting w/my doctor tomorrow.
I HATE needles, so this is alittle hard for me to do every morning ... but my glucose levels after eating takes less than 2 hrs to be in the normal range of 100 - 120. Very happy with that!

I have been taking this since New Years Eve. My sugar was above 275 and the first dose dropped my down to 87. The morning sugar is between 87 and 100 now. The only side effect I have had is the constipation. I don't drink any sodas, not eating any sugars and stopped the pastas and starches, this was my choice to try and make myself healthier. I still take metformin twice a day. I have lost weight, I don't know how much but my clothes are getting very loose. I hope to get where I won't have to continue taking this or the meds. They say its possible

I have been on this drug for two weeks now, the first week at .6 and now 1.2 for the next 2 months then I see my dr. again. But I can speak for the last two weeks and call them a big whopping success!! Yes, there is belching and nausea, it has faded. I have diarrhea, it has not faded. The  so worth it part: blood sugars are down from 405 to 157....in TWO weeks! I do not know about weight loss amounts..haven't weighed yet. Certainly feel thinner and my pants feel looser. Prior to this drug, I was on Januvia, novolog, and metformin. Kept only the metformin (1000mg 2x day) and added this Victoza. I know this isn't the perfect drug with the side effects, but it is an answer for me.   Major tip: eat small...and I mean small...meals throughout the day. Drink slowly in between the meals. The only time I have vomited was on the second day when I ate a bowl of soup and then drank three cups of tea right away....I won't do that again!!  And don't even attempt a six inch subway sub in one sitting. I won't do that again either. I swear this drug is like a lap-band you inject! :))))

Doc switched me to Victoza from Byetta to bring down expense.  Nice not to have to take but once a day.  Taking 1000 Metformin twice a day as well.  Lost 10 pounds after starting Victoza, just as I did for Byetta (but lost 30 then).  Took Victoza for 13 months. Quit because my husband and friends said my mouth smelled like a sewer; I had thought it was just me tasting it, but they could smell it as well.  I was belching a lot, flatulence as well.  But that taste was what drove me back to Byetta.  Weight loss stops pretty fast; I think it is a side effect of the nausea making you not eat, not the drug doing something swell.  Lots of itching in the last 6 months of taking it.  Didn't change my morning blood sugar levels any better than Byetta or just Metformin, which were 120 and doc wanted below 100.  Turns out morning high due to predawn low while sleeping, causing the sugar to swing high.  This is a known phenomena; if it's just your morning sugars high, consider that. Victoza good for 3-4 months, then just like other meds.  Expensive.  Insurance company gave me hell continually about finding an alternative. Beware the sewer mouth. (I guess things were staying in the stomach so long, they were beginning to rot.)  Have your friends/spouse check your breath.

Have been on 1.2 for 8 months.A1C went from 6.8 to last week of 4.4. Only taking Victoza. Since A1C was so low, Dr took me off all meds for diabetes. I did suffer constipation but that is from stomsch staying full.
Have frequent bouts of nausea early morning and sometimes several times during the day

I have reduced my metformin to once daily with vitoza in AM Metformin before bed. Lost weight , sugar went from 180's to 120 or less. My wife on the same program lost 52 pounds in 8 weeks ! Paula Dean takes it and so do WE !

I have been taking this drug for a year now.  The first two weeks were horrible but I am use to it now.  Blood glucose  has gone down a little (using 1.8mg dose) and lost some weight.  Still having issues with throat feeling swollen and heartburn twice a week.  I do not like injecting myself in the stomach.....my doctor states that is the place he wants me to administer the drug.
Used for one year, able to maintain weight, there is no loss, but stabilized. Injection is easier than Glucose meter test.

I have used this drug for almost a month, but since I have switched to a higher dose, it has been given me some serious stomach pains and cramps, I have seen a little weight loss and appetite not being good, so I hope it is working.
Third week of Victoza. Stomach pain is really bad. Head ache for the first week but is now gone. But the stomach pain and wanting to vomit is horrible. I am also having hiccups

I take this to control sugar levels after eating. The first use my sugar level dropped to the normal range. It has increased my general sense of well being and side effects are minimal. I tried this after failing miserably with byetta.  Bonus is the weight loss.
Victoza has helped reduce my sugar levels and curb my appetite thus helping me lose weight.
this medication has my blood sugar in an acceptable range after 3 weeks of use.
i have been having a lot of belching and nauseated feeling. is this normal for this medication.
been using for 18 months for pre diabetes.  Lost 15 pounds effortlessly.  has anyone else started to lose weight again?  Especially if I modify my sweets and exercise.  :(
I have taken byetta BEFORE AND IT MADE ME REALLY SICK NOW THIS DOESN'T BOTHER ME AT ALL AND IT IS EASY TO TAKE.
I'm in my 2nd month of taking this & I feel great now, was sick feeling for the first two weeks & I lost 10 lbs. It has brought my readings down a lot & I love it now. I'm almost up to taking 1.8
My diabetes levels are consistently lower using this drug. The side effects are frequent flatuence & diarrhea, though this drug may just worsen my lactose intolerance.

I have been on victoza for almost 4 months with really no side effects, but now in the last two weeks having constipation and severe acid reflux. Is anyone else experincing this or have a solution because really dont want to stop taking it.
I have been taking Victoza for 1 year now and my A1c went from 8.7 to 6 and I have lost 35 pounds! Had trouble for the first few months with nausea, but that has subsided and I feel great!

this is my 2nd week and I had no nausea, small headaches all day the first week but woke up to terrible "egg burps" this morning, does this go away??? Its terrible I hate eggs to start with and this is the worst thing yet.

I have been on this drug for two years and I am concerned about the effect this will have on my throid gland and it is not curable if you get it.  My DR. is no longer in business and I take it with Lantas Insulin.

Have been on Victoza for a little over 30 days. statrted with 0.6mg and went to 1.2 after using up 1st pen. have just started 3rd pen (1.2mg) and only side-effects are some vertigo and mild constipation. not certain if either are related to increased dosage, but suspect the vertigo may be as my sugar has dropped from an average of 170+ to 123 for the past 30 days. I am impressed with the quick return to more normal sugar and have labs coming up in 2 weeks so will be interested in seeing what A1C will be. also take 1mg of Glimmepride after 1st meal. I hope the vertigo will pass but will discuss with Doctor after labs.
im on my seconed week of this and i have a lump on my tounge

i have been on victoza for 4 weeks. i have lost 10 lbs and my legs were really swollen and they went down on the 2nd day of use. am on 1.2 with no side affects and i am very picky and everything makes me sick. Now i am trying to eat healthy and at least walk

Take this drug! Although the first two weeks were terrible. I was nauseated and wretched, I kept having to cry, and had insomnia. There is a light at the end of the 2week tunnel! It really does curb your appetite. It does this by slowing down your stomach so you feel full on a quarter of a NY bagel. I was finally able to eat just 3 small saucer sized meals. I had always tried to cut down portion size before, but couldn't because i would get hungry. Not now!  Drink plenty of water in little sips all day. I dropped to 1dose of lantus at night and totally cut out humolog fast acting insulin. Still take 2000 mgs metformin but was switched to the time released kind today. My numbers went from the 200's to 120 first thing in the morning and 135 2 hours after dinner. I've lost 15lbs now and i'm in my third week. I have added 2 pieces of fruit in between meals if i feel like it and a 1 inch piece of cake or pie with my evening [email protected] 11pm. I can live with this as I keep loosing. I will write again to report my progress.
I take this for metabolic syndrome. I have had a good response. I feel better. I have lost 18 pounds in the first 5 months. No side effects. I guess I was lucky.

I have been taking Victoza for 9 months along with 1000 mg metforman 2 x's per day and glipizde 1 x per day.  This is the wonder drug for me.  My glucose levels are in check and I have lost 30lbs. to date, have lots of energy again, and the once per day dosage is perfect for my lifestyle.
It seems to lower my blood sugar even on the smallest dosage. My sugar has been high for some time.
It is so easy to use and it is definitely effective. I would recommend it over Byetta.

I am on Victoza for 2 months, my fasting levels in the morning are anywhere from 189 to 234 and I also have a backache on the right above the waist line.  I have developed a strange red rash on my left forearm it doesn't itch, I am not sure what this is.  I really haven't felt like myself since taking this medication, no energy, I'm  tried all the time and belching a lot.  Is anyone else having some of these symptoms?

Started 3 wks ago, had headaches & vertigo the first week, as well as nausea & stomach ache.  Numbers are coming down, and I have lost 8 lbs.  Really tired, feel I could sleep all day.  took with 500 mg Metformin at first, stomach upset was terrible so stopped the metformin.  Also taking Gliclazide in the morning.  Will hang in there, but this is not fun.  Needles don't hurt, lancets are much worse.  Really expensive.

The victoza shot made me feel so much better. The shot was easy and painless. But the side effects were terrible. I had severe migrain headaches and stomach pain. I took victoza for some time and then just could not tolerate it anymore. Every person is different though. My husband takes this shot and has no problems at all. He feels better and glad that he started it. So try it and stick with it for a time and then decide if it is right for you. Each person reacts differently to medications. As Christians we thank God for Dr.s and medications. We also know that God heals miraculously when He chooses too. What is most important is that we receive salvation Romans 10:9-10. (www.intouch.org)

I was put on insulin for glucose levels ranging between 250-400 but insulin only would raise my sugars 100 points on the average. I tried 3-5 different kinds and none worked. Finally my doctor prescribed Victoza and the first day they dropped from 250+ average to 175! i used .6 for a week and stayed at 200. I then went up to 1.2 dose and sugars are staying in 160 range after few days! My glucose numbers also used to jump all over the place but now are stabling out. I have had queasy stomach but after about 1/2 hr or so it settles down and seems to calm as my system adjusts. I have only been on it a couple weeks.
This medication is a good drug! it works for me! I've been taking it for 3 years

I have been on Victoza for about 6 wks. I have not had any nausea. I take the shot at bedtime. It has brought my blood sugar down to 160-170 from 220.  I have lost about 6 lbs sense I started tha medicine. I am taking .6mg a day. The only side effects that I have had is tightness in the chest.  It was so bad that I went to the hospital thinking I had a heart attach. I'd like to know if this has been a problem with anyone else. I still have some tightness in the chest every day, but no way near what it used to be.

I started on Victoza 3-11-2011. I weighted 362 lbs and my A1c was 13. I now weigh 284 and my A1C is 7.2 pretty good for 13 months.I no longer crave food, have lots more energy, and can walk 4 miles without taking A break when I started I couldn't walk 1\2 mile without stopping.
sometimes makes me vomit
Has been great in my treatment of typeII diabetes. Blood sugars are regulated! Love it!
intialy it was working well after one year of use effect started diminishing came back to same as it was one year back

I am only on Victoza 1.2mg for 2 1/2 weeks.  My hg is down significantly however the fatigue is terrible.  I am finding it difficult getting up in the morning. In the past I was fine on 6 hrs sleep.  Now I need more tha 10 hrs.  Not happy about this.

Hi, I started taking this medication about a two weeks ago. It's been one of the WORST treatments I have ever been on. I was vomiting all day long and severe stomach cramps. I went off the medication last Saturday and on Tuesday I had to be taken to the emergency room. I was hospitalized for almost a week, the doctor diagnosed me with severe vertigo and am awaiting to be evaluated by an ear specialist this Monday. My doctors believe this to be a possible side effect from using Victoza. I know for sure I will never take this medication again nor will I endorse it's use. For me it's been a horrible experience.

I lost over 10 lbs have not lost anymore , been taking it for over 6 months now. I love it BUT I am so irritable... am I the only one with this side effect otherwise no cramps nothing also a little headache in the mornings.

Soreness at site of injection, bruising.  I feel far less hungry - in other words, the stomach pains have ended.  I have not lost weight though.  It's my understanding that this med only works for about 2 years and I'm close to that time now.
I am having stomach and breathing problems.

Love, Love, Love Victoza. Feel so much better. I've been on a year now. A1C dropped immedietly.lost 65 pounds so far,and changed my life. I feel lucky my doctor sent me in this direction. Tried metformin for 3 weeks, like to kill me. Threw up all the time.  No side effects from victoza. I just can't say enough positive things about how victoza has changed my life for the better.

I had extreme fatigue as my BS stayed below 60. I had severe upset stomach, severe head aches, severe indigestion, severe low BS. I also had some minor itching. I lost 11 lbs in 1 week 2 days, but that was bc I could not eat. My BS would not stablize, so I am now trying Symlin and hoping for good results. This medicine would be good if it didn't have so many unruly side effects.

I have lost 75 pounds since june 2011. when i started taking this i did not exercise and lost 40 pounds.starting using treadmill in nov. and now i walk 3 miles a day.i love this medicine. i was also taken of actos. i still take a med twice a day.
Morning fasting blood sugar level has dropped close to 15 points so far.
I am not sure if this is working...only had 3 injections...have severe nausea, severe headaches and severe heart burn for 3 days.

I have type 1 diabetes, and this medication is the best thing that ever happened to me (of course, I still need insulin).  I started to use this instead of Symlin, and and it works 500% better at not causing my sugar to spike after meals.  I have also been able to decrease the amount of insulin I take by about half, and I've only been on it for a little less than a month.  The problem - it's not appoved for the treatment of type 1 diabetes so my insurance won't pay for it!!!!  Once I use up the sample I got from my doc's office, I'm out of luck:(
I just started taking this a week ago and struggling with the nausea, just bought sea bands to help, has anyone else tried this as well?

when i first started using victoza, i noticed within the first day that my level came down, and remained under 94 - 130 while I continued the medication, It was  reading 188 - 294 before this time, then I stopped due to the cost of the medication  $88.00 for 2x amonth, 2 pens that was my copay. I couldnt continue it was to expensive with my other medications.  But my glucose level went back up again and I have started taking it again, the price is now $45.00 a month, half the price on my copay, and it is working with half the dose.  I'm happy with the results so far.  But thinking of having some type of weight loss surgery.  Lap Band? ? ? ?  Have to research it some more.

Only on the meds a week and my numbers are going down - bothe FBS and weight! Thankful that I've had no side effects and that it's so easy to administer.  I take this in the AM and 2000ER Metformin at night.

I started taking this for weight loss.I felt like I was very ill for the first 10 days ( started at .06-went to 1.8 by day 10 ). It helped me alot, lost the need to eat all the time. Lost the cravings for sugar most of the time. Yes, they're side effectts too this like most drugs out there. I figured I would give myself 30 days and all negative side effects are gone. This is definately worth it, just had to rough it out for the first 2 weeks. By the way, lost  20 lbs !( with diet and gym 5x a week ).

I took 3 injections of this medicine at the .6 dose. It decreased my appetite but I experienced horrible nausea and burning in my throat. I stopped it because I have to work. My doctor is going to be angry

I have been on this shot along with 2000mg of Metformin and 45mg of Actos... The Dr who prescribed this shot told me that it would lower my blood sugar levels and also help me loose weight... It's been a month and a half and I have gained 25 lbs.. Not real happy with this. I'm having problems moving around and also have no energy..My kidneys feel like they are shutting down. I feel 10 times worse now then I did 2 months ago....
nausea all the time. saw no difference in blood sugars

I have been on Victoza for about 2+ weeks.  I gradually went from .6-1.8.  I had a really tough week or so with the dizziness, headache, heaviness on my chest and TERRIBLE ITCHING!  I'm soooo delighted that others talked about the itching.  The last few days I have noticed I'm having TERRIBLE abdominal and back pain under my ribs.  I had my gallbladder out in Nov 2011, so I think it's pancreatitis.  I see the doctore this afternoon.  I do like what Victoza is doing to my numbers, both AM fasting and during the day, much, much lower.  I have almost no appetite and I have lost 10 lbs. in such a short period of time.  I also take 2000 mg Metformin at dinner.  Not sure what the DR. will say today.  Sometimes you have to wonder if the doctors want the numbers going down at the expense of the patient.

I was extremely allergic to this drug and had to stop taking it after only 2 doses.  I had major problems with itching, shortness of breath, heaviness in my chest, bloating - it was strange because I am not a sick person nor do I have extreme reactions to medications.  The fact that I did to this one - who knows - but I did and that has made me reluctant to take other meds that are injectible.  Try it on for yourself - if it works great! if not watch you symptoms!!
This medication has helped in controlling my blood sugar but it makes  it causes insomnia and makes me hyper. Anyone else with this problelm?

My blood sugar meter readings now seem to match my low-carb diet.  I find myself having less feelings of hunger through out the day.  I did have some intestinal problems the first week, in the way of bowel movements, but never so severe it kept me from going to school and daily life.
My numbers were high and now in the 112 - 125 range. Glad I am taking this.
Only Rx that could and has brought my high numbers down to controlling area.

This medication is very good.  It is easy to administer to yourself and even if you don't like needles it is better that pricking your finger (less pain).  I have been having indigestion since I have been taking this medicine.  I not sure if the medicine is cause the problem.

Developed type two after a drunk driver hit my police car and I gained 35 pounds and began to eat poorly.  Tried all sorts of medications and this one has been the easiest and best so far.  Concerned about the thyroid cancer, but will be vigilant.  Did not like needles, but I do it on the side of my stomach and can not even feel it, unlike the finger testing.  I have also recently lost my gall bladder and have developed a candida yeast infection which has also messed up my stomach.  I was on massive amounts of anti biotics and am not sure if victoza played a role in that or not.  Trying to get my stomach balanced.  Have lost 25 pounds, but that was as much contributed to almost dying from the gall bladder and not being able to eat for two months.  Blood sugars and A1c have been GREAT since starting this.  I also take metformin (1000mg's) twice a day.  Have had to go on and off metformin due to some of the testing and the surgeries I have had, which seems to increase numbers.  Together, victoza and metformin seem to work very, very well even without major improvements in my diet.  Dont give up on the victoza/metformin.  Try tweaking things a bit until you feel better.  Good luck!

Was on glucophage 500BD and Diamicron 30 daily. Difficulty in maintaining sugars. HbA1c started to climb. Started on Victoza and ease at control of sugars. Off the Diamicron and sugars maintained with just 500 of glucophage a day. HbA1c down to 5 after 6 weeks from 7.2.

I have a fear of needles and this is VERY easy to use and there is no pain. Poking your finger is more painful by far, this is EASY. I love the small needle and it's easy to use, does not require much to inject the medicine. For the first time since I've been diagnosed with Type 2 Diabetes, my sugar levels have dropped to normal levels and I am losing weight finally.
PEN ISO HARD TO PUSH WHEN INJRCTING SND IEDAL TO SMALL

this medicine made me feel the sickest i have ever felt in my life ! the nausea warning should be changed to " makes you feel like your guts are being turned inside out " ! however, i am on day 7 and starting to feel a little better and my fasting sugars have already dropped into the normal range. still feel like i have a boulder in my stomach but am hoping that will eventually go away.

I have been on this med. for two weeks and I am loving it. My sugar has been under control for the first time sense becoming a diabetic in 2000. I have been on every kind of diabetic med. and nothing has helped.
Extreme digestive matters, including dirrahea, indigestion, and stomach cramping

I have lost over 50 lbs in the last 6 months, my a1c has went from 8.5 to 5.9 over this period. My sugar stays in control which it never has before. I have gastro problems with eggy burbs and then usually throw up and then everything is fine for a while.  The dosage I am taking is .6 + 4 clicks. I have tryed to go to 1.2 but the above gastro gets worse.  If I don't over eat, I don't think I would have a problem but occasionally I do.  I have reduced my other diabetic meds too.  This is great, had to buy some new cloths though.
Have been using for one week and already seeing average blood sugar drops by 60 mg/dl average.

I've been on Victoza for a year now and have been very satisfied with my results.  My blood sugars are controlled for the first time in about 10 years!!  I did have quite a bit of nausea at first and definitely had "eggy" burps that I've read others have experienced as well.  The nausea got better once I changed my injection to the morning rather than night.  And I've noticed that if I'm disciplined about taking it at the same time each day, then the nausea doesn't seem to come.  I lost 50 lbs within the first 6 months and have stayed fairly steady since then (hoping for more :) ).

I'm a married homemaker and mother to 3 active kids ages 15, 11, and 10. I'm constantly on-the-go, so I don't always have all the time I need for "me". This medicine made my life so much simpler.  As of the 29th of this month I will have been taking Victoza for 1 year. In that time, my A1C went from 10.8 to 6.6 and I've lost nearly 60 pounds. AMAZING! I had a little bit of Nausea for the first week or so, but then nothing since. Also, the nausea with Victoza was NOTHING like the nausea I experienced with Byetta. The Byetta was awful and I'd tried just about EVERY other type of medicine out there including Insulin without success.  I'm SO glad my Endocrinologist prescribed Victoza...it has completely changed my life. The once daily injection is a breeze and I've never experienced a "low" as my blood sugar is steady all day long. I LOVE this medication and I would highly recommend it to any Type 2 Diabetic. It worked miracles for me...and it will change your life too.  [email protected]

My doctor prescibed this medication because I was at a very high risk of developing diabetes. I have been on this medication for 1 month and I have lost 10 pounds.  It certainly has suppressed my appetite but I am extremely constipated.
This has been the best I have ever used I have lost weight my levels have been between 100 and 115 daily my A1C has also dropped sick to my stomach for about a week no problem since
since using this drug my blood sugar has been so mush better.  way down.

This med has been very effective in lowering my BG levels and A1C numbers. The nausea was initially a problem. I only experienced vomiting once, but that was when I had eaten more than usual. This drug lowers blood sugar and initially supresses the appetite.

I have been taking this drug for almost 2 years and saw a quickk drop in my daily sugar tests backed up by lowering a1c from 8 down to a steady test at 4.5 to 5. also saw a 12 % weight loss. simple to take after getting past the first shot.

I've been using Victoza for about 5 weeks. Before that I was taking Byetta twice daily. With victoza I am no longer using insulin (lantus) and feeling WAY BETTER! My A1C test 3 months ago was at 8.6, and as of last week, I have an A1C of 6.5!!!  This medication has really helped to bring my blood glucose back under control and I am feeling so much better now.

I started Victoza 3 weeks ago. I have some nauesa but my morning fasting numbers went from 135 to 95. I'm feeling better every day and I've lost 11 pounds so far. It has helped to control my appetite.

I have been on Victoza for about 6 weeks. I am currently on 1.2 dose with 1000 mg Metformin 2x per day. I had the nausea for about the 1st wk but that has subsided. I did have some constipation and diarrhea, but I am not sure if that is from the Metformin. I take my injection at night so if there is any nausea I would be asleep.  I would recommend taking at night if you are experiencing nausea.  I have lost over 12 pounds so far and my last A1C was 6.3. I also have been experiancing a decreased appitite.

Been on Victoza for 2 weeks. .6 dose seemed to be working. Doctor upped it to 1.2. After a couple days had horrible side effects. Felt like throwing up all day. Terrible diarrhea. Doctor moved me back to .6. Will see how it goes. Definitely an appetite suppressant.

Is anybody but me worried about the side effects, most specificially thyroid cancer and or pancreatitis or pancreatic cancer or gall stones? I resisted because of the risk factors but relented. I have only been on it less than 10 days so I still have nausea. I hope that goes away!!!!!!
diarrhea with urgency about 3 hours after administration

My A1c levels have been consistently under 7 in the 3 years or so, while taking this medication. Admittedly, I have difficulty eating properly in the sense that I usually eat but once a day. I also use Metformin 1000 x 2 a day and my daily blood sugar levels average around 130. It's difficult for me to say whether I have any side effects specifically stemming from Victoza as I have several medical conditions for which I am prescribed other meds. Overall, Victoza has by far been the better of the injectables I've used over the past several years. Levimear = weight gain. Byetta = low blood sugar and stomach problems. On the down side, Victoza is an expensive medication as a BCBS tier 3 $40 per month copay

Has any one had trouble sleeping on this??? I was on Byetta for 5 years and started feeling really bad recently, so the Dr switched me to Victoza to see if it would help. I feel alot better but my numbers are not where I want them to be, but its only been 3 weeks. I hope this improves with time.
Can't really say how this Med is doing, it is EXPENSIVE! Even with insurance.

I started take in Victoza in Feb 2011. I've lost 10 lbs. I'm now at 130 lbs. I'm on the 1.2 dosage. My A1c taken in Aug 2011 was 5.3.  In May 2011 I noticed my hair was thinning. Hair loss is not one of the side effects. However, this drug does slow down the digestive system which can interfere vitamin and mineral abortion. I started taking a daily vitamin/mineral supplement.  I also started take additional zinc (with copper include). My hair is growing back. I have little short hairs growing back.  Hair loss also can happen when a person looses weith too quickly.

After 6 months on Victoza, my morning sugar are down about 17%.  My P.M. sugars are well under 105.  Not like other users, I have not lost any significant weight. Started out with a bit of nausea, but it is all gone now.  I would highly recommend Victoza.
Nausa upset stomach but good weight loss still using lost 86 lbs

I have been on Victoza for five weeks, lost 15 pounds, and have morning blood sugars that have dropped in half, from 190 down to 95.  Only using 0.6 per day, and the appetite suppresant alone would be worth it.  I guess I'm one of the fortunate ones who have no side affects, outside of a slight nausea the first day.  So far, so good.
Have had great success with victoza. After initial nausea and weight loss, things settled down. I am still losing weight though not as fast. Diabetes under control

Have been on Victoza for about 3 months. It took a few weeks to get to 1.8 due to nausea. My blood sugars have lowered drastically and am very happy with drug.  One of lucky ones whose insurance covers.  The only real side effect is "rotten egg" burps which are embarassing in public because of smell.  Any suggestions?

Was prescribed Victoza for pre-diabetes. Has the usual side effects of nausea, headaches, which subsided after a few weeks.  Was not sure about how this med. affected my BG levels because docter did not advise me to do so and I was not familiar with diabetic practices.  I lost about 10 lbs.  I developed new side effects, however, after a few months of use.  I had increased pulse rate, severe fatigue, greatly increased hot flashes, and a surge in my apetite.  So I took myself off of this med. and will advise doctor at next appt.  I have since gained about 5 lbs back.  One note to consider; I am on a lot of other meds for fibromyalgia and depression which may have had a bad interaction with Victoza.

The first two weeks were difficult with the nausea and being tired all the time.  I’ve lost about 7 lbs in two weeks.  My appetite is gone and I eat small normal size meals.  My morning blood sugars went from 200 to 90 within days.  I fell better that I have in years.  I did use the discount prescription card at Walgreens and they charged mw $35.00 when the program is $25.00????

Has anyone out there  experienced hair loss since using victoza?  I have been on victoza for 1 1/2 years.  Very good results, but, after about 6 months noticed my hair beginning to thin quite a bit.  It has continued to thin at a slower rate than at first, but would like to hear if any one else has experienced this as a possible side effect.

Istarted on Victoza Nov. 2010. Since on it, my A1C has gone from a previous 7.7 to my current 5.9.  I have lost 60lbs and feel well. I do watch my diet and am more able to exercise since I am not so big.  Initially I had nausea and headache on the medicine.  However my endocrinologist advised me to go back on my dose and increase my dose more gradually and my nausea subsided.  I do have an occasional headache.  I think it is an incredible medication if immense help to me!
It does make you nauseated at first, in fact it really made me sick, but after about a week and a half I was feeling okay. It is helping my blood sugar it lowered my A1C by .9 the first 2 mths.
iv been on this medfor about 3months and it works great for me.I am at the maxium dose now. Lot better than Byetta which was real inconvient

When first started seemed to lower levels. Dr took me completely off Metformin.  Then my levels started to rise. Went back on it with the Metformin but numbers still continue to be high. Did nothing to control my apetite, in fact I'm hungry all the time.
I have been vomiting often. It's quite frustrating.

I have used Victoza for 1yr. I am 1.2 dose and remain. 1.8 caused dizziness. A1-c great! BS numbers good. Did have to up my dose of Zoloft and if I forget to take Victoza which I have when I get busy, more that two days I start heart palps. I have lost 20lbs. Nausea at first but not much now. Still on Metformin 1000mg 2x day. Would like to lower this.

I have been on Victoza and have lost 20 pounds. I was precious on Byetta for 4 years and have lost a total of 50 pounds. Everything was fine until last week when I obtained an abcess at my injection site and spent a few days in the hospital with IV antibiotics. I will not stop Victoza, but am now very careful with cleansing the injection site with an alcohol prep.
I feel victoza is working very good fo me, Big loss of appetite. Sugar not real low yet, been of this medicine for two weeks.
JUST STARTED 2 WEEKS AGO. SO FAR MILD MILD NAUSEA, AND CERTAINLY A DECREASE IN APPETITE AND THE SUGAR NUMBERS HAVE GONE FROM OVER 400 TO 130'S ....

Diagnosed with DM 2 in mid 2010. Dr prescribed this medication and I did worry about an injection everyday.  My blood sugars dropped from 400+ at time of diagnosis to 90-110 fasting and after meals.   VERY expensive because the company still has the patent on the medication.  Skip a few months and my insurance changed- had to start using Byetta.  The Byetta caused all sorts of side effects and I stopped taking it until I could appeal my insurance co to cover the Victoza again.  Looking forward to lower blood sugars and decreased appetite again.   Very good medication in my opinion, just sad it is so cost prohibitive to people without insurance or poor coverage plans.
Lost 21-24lbs in 3 months, blood sugars are great, avg 98 no real side effects for me  Best thing to come along for me in a long time

I have been on this medication now for 6 months, with no serious side effects. I have lost 17 lbs and my BS #'s stays in the 90's and low 100's. This medicine is very expensive. Without insurance I could not afford it,

Developed vision problem due to high blood sugar.  End. doctor put me on victoza plus Janumet of 50/1000 to lower my blood sugar [130/180 day/eve, AIC 8.6]. Terrible nausea, lost of appetite but not losing weight, headaches and profuse sweating - worse than hot flashes.  Went from 0.6 to 1.2 after 5 days and symptons better but not great - vision slowly improving. Appetite still not there and smell of food makes me ill. Seeing Retina dr. in 2 weeks as well as my End.doctor for their input and recommendations.
It makes me VERY sick to my stomach.

Started Victoza in February 2011.  Have lost about 15 pounds.  I also take 1000 mg Metformin at dinner, the Victoza in the morning.  A1C went from 6.9 to 6.1 and is now at 6.2. Still a little uneasy about giving myself an injection and conerned that my body will not respond to any of these medications after being on them a while.
I have been taking this drug for about two weeks now, I cannot get over the naseau!  I hardly eat anything and have very little appitite. I wish the nausea would stop then Id love it!

Made me sick to my stomach daily, constipation, and at times it made me very hyper and I was unable to sleep.  It is also extremely expensive costing over $300.00 a month for just one daily injection.

Within two weeks of starting I felt better and my blood/glucose levels were lower. I  then had to stop the Victoza because my gfr readings were too low, my blood levels started to rise, I have gout in my knee and feel poorly. If possible I will resume Victosa as soon as I can.

I started taking VICTOZA about 3 months ago. First weak I experienced nausea and constipation but and during the first month I lost 8 lb. The next month I lost another 6 lb and now so far I lost 20 lb. I hope this continues since the blood sugar is normal and I am feeling not hungry for longer periods of time.

I've been on Victoza for over a year.   My blood sugar was nearly perfect and I lost 40 lbs in 4 months.  Then.....  All of the appetite suppression went away, and of course my weight started going up and up.   I have now gained back the 40 pounds plus 10 more!   I'm very disappointed.   My doctor doesn't have an explanation.  I did notice that one time when I accidently double dosed myself (several hours apart) that the appetite control came back, at least for a few hours.  I just don't see a lot of difference between taking two 1000mg of Glumetza, and taking the Glumetza plus the Victoza.  This is all based on my personal experience.   I think in August I'm going to go back on Byetta for a while.

I initially started taking Victoza about two months ago.  I would inject it every morning at 6:00 A.M. ant take my hypertension meds (by mouth with food) at the same time.  As I titrated the dose up to 1.8mg.'s my blood pressure began going up.  By time I reached the 1.8 mg. dose my BP had reached a really dangerous level (174/108 so I stopped taking it and my BP dropped back to it's normal(118/76) or reasonably there about.  Needless to say, my physician wasn't happy that I had discontinued the Victoza with out consulting him.  He went as far as to say "the Victoza wouldn't do that"(time for a new Doc.) referring to the elevated BP.  Long story short..the doc. changed my BP meds and placed me back on the Victoza...Same problem with the BP again.  Not wanting to stop the Victoza because it was really controlling my blood sugar readings and food cravings, I did some more research decided to try taking the Victoza 3 hours after my BP meds....Bingo..BP has stayed within my normal range and the Victoza is working well.  My guess is that the Victoza works so well at slowing stomach emptying that the my BP meds were probably only trickling into my system if they were being absorbed at all.  Only other problem was some constipation...that seems to have passed (sorry for the bad pun).
I have been taking this drug for six days. Nausea, diahrrea, no actual vomiting but have been crying for two days! I also take Prozac. Anyone out there on both of these meds?

Been on Victoza for 1.5 months.  1 week at 0.6 dose, the rest at 1.2 until the last few days when I went up to 1.8.  It just isn't working!  My blood sugar is higher than on my previous regimen.  Sadly, the side effect of weight loss hasn't happened to me, either.  I talked to the doctor, wanting to go back to the fairly effective combo I was on before, but she just said to go up to 1.8.  That was 3 days ago and my fasting blood sugar is still over 200 every morning.
I only started this 3 days ago. The first night I was up with stomach pain, nausea, and head ache. Haven't been sick since but I can't seem to stop crying. Has anyone else had this strange symptom???
I am one who does not like needles.  It has lowered my blood level and I have lost some weight
lost weight and blood sugar in the normal range.
I have even lossed some weight with this medication its help keep my blood sugar down to normal ranges for a year now
Have been on this med for awhile, doing great until I switched ins. co. New ins. does not cover. Found at a canada phar. at a extremelly reasonable price. Drug co and ins co are screwing us.

I've been taking two diffeent types of insulin (fast acting and a 24 hr. type that levels me out for a 24 hour period) for at least 8-10 years.  I recently found that not only had I gained weight but my insulin use increased substantially (daily fast acting up to 70 units; evening insulin up at 62 units).  I began using Victoza about 1 month ago and the results have been startling.  There was a 2 1/2 day period that other than the Victoza shot, I took NO insulin whatsoever!  While using Victoza I soon learned that any corrective fast acting insulin must be reduced dramatically or there are severe "going low" consequences.  No problem now with adjustments I've made (I take no more than 7 units of fast acting insulin for a full  day and I reduced my evening type dose to 42 units.)  Now when I awake in the morning, my blood sugars are between 80-133 and are relatively normal throughout the day.  A huge change for me.  I have also lost 15 lbs. and have a suppressed appetite (something that goes along with the Victoza use).  The side effect for me is nausea.  This side effect began on day 1 and continued for almost 20 hours/day for a month.  Now my nausea has been significantly reduced but my appetite remains suppressed.  This is a miracle drug!  My doctor says this drug contains a certain hormone (nomally produced by the body) that directs the pancreas to produce more insulin (the stated purpose of Victoza). Apparently, I have not been making this hormone for some time.  Now, 1 Victoza shot of 1.2 units/day is all it takes and I'm close to normal. I hope this all continues.
on victoza 5 months a1c down from 11.5 to 7.9 side effects go away at 1.2 dose Constipation is still a problem but low b/s readings are worth it

Tried Byetta - dropped by BS too much.  Started Victoza, within first 2 weeks stopped 2 other medications for diabetes.  Have had very few side effects.  Additionally have lost 30 lbs in 6 months because I feel full longer and I am not always craving food because of variance in BS.  I am glad this is working for me.

I had been taking Byetta before starting Victoza so my side effects were minimal.  It has been working great for me, controlling my blood sugar and also my appetite.  My A1C's have been between 5.8 and 6.3.  I have had just a few occasions where my sugars dropped low.  So far this drug has worked great for me.
I have zero side effects but it's also not having any effect on my blood sugar.  I'm at 1.2.  I just don't think going to the max will make a difference.

I JUST STARTED TAKING THIS MEDICATION A FEW DAYS AGO .  i am taking the lowest dosage of 0.6, I have to wait a week before I can take the next dose of 1.2.  I sugar has been up and down and I am concerned about it.

Cannot take the nausea,headache,weakness, I lost a few # due to the fact I was too sick to eat!Feeling like this and trying to work as a nurse is not a good combination, will stop this med.0.6 did not have as severe side effects as 1.2 but had no positive results. Will take a different route
No side effects, good wt loss and glucose control.

I have been on Victoza for 3 weeks and am now up to the 1.8 dosage.  Just can't seem to get over the nauseaus, tired feeling all the time.  Definitely has decreased my appetite.  Just wondering how much longer these side effects will be around.

Just started taking this a few weeks ago.  I didn't have significan side effects until I started the 1.8 dose.  Back pain, abdominal pain, horrible diarrhea, reflux and "rotten egg" burps - feeling very sick for two days now.  It has definitely helped my numbers... actually 89 the other day! This is down from my norm of over 200!  The shots themselves are relatively painless, but the side effects at the higher dosage are pretty miserable.  I hope they will subside soon.

Been on this medication for about 4 months and it is fabulous. Blood sugars were normal within days at 1.2 dosage. Lost about 22 pounds though that has slowed down. My only issues are the cost which I currently have a 1 yr. discount card from Victoza for $25/mo. and the belching/constipation. Just uncomfortable but not horrible. I went off oral meds because of gastro issues (allergic to sulfa) and had been on Byetta (didn't work) and Symlin (unpredictable nausea) as well as lantus and novloog. Am now off novolog entirely and dosage on lantus is cut by about 1/3.

when i first started it,i lost weight.however the longer i was taking it i regained the weight.now i am maintaining the weight rather than gaining. i have been experiencing stomach and back pain which i thought was irritable bowel syndrome.now i have read the side effects i am not so sure about this.
Makes me sick on my stomach

I was on Byetta before but my body got used to it so I went on Victoz.  It worked great and my A1c dropped from 9.6 to 7.6 in 3 - 4 months.  However, now that I have Kaiser for insurance, they don't approve of this drug and are forcing me to take insulin.  The insulin isn't working and I'm furious that they won't put me back on Victoza unless I want to pay the full price... $700+ for 3 wks of medicine.  What can I do to get back on Victoza??? I'm despirate and my blood sugars keep running in the 320 + range.  Anyone have suggestions?  Email me at [email protected]

I have been taking victoza for 2 months, along with metformin and Lantus. It took about a month to really "kick in" but when it did, I brought my BS down to the low 100's and I lost 20 lbs so far. I was able to lower my Lantus from 55 iu down to 30 iu. I have not experienced any adverse side effects!
I have had no side effects! It has lowered my blood sugars. I am eating less which good for me because I need to lose weight.

over the years have used Byetta (no good for me) Levemir and Novolog (caused severe bloating) various Oral meds incl. metformin which disagrees with me, and finally now on Victoza. Been using Victoza for 4 months now also using amaryl 4mg per day and lost 34lbs, no more swelling or bloating. Started on .6 and went to 1.2 within 2 weeks and now on 1.8. Great appetite suppressor. currently trying Metformin again as well to help lower BG numbers, however only able to handle 125mg 2x per day without side affects. Only problem now is constant indigestion and burping, very little acid. I think it is the Metformin and higher 1.8 dose combined, so will hang in there and see how  the next 2 months go, adding an anti indigestion med to the mix. overall very happy with experience and on the way to losing another 15lbs this three months... AND lowering BG#... we'll see.

I've had hypoglycemia since my 30's..now in my 60's I vasillate between type 2 and hypo with sugars going high and/or dropping low.  This drug has helped me to balance out these highs and lows... I have been using it for 6 months.  lost 5 lbs at the beginning but no symptoms or problems with the drug... just a balanced sugar level..

I have lost 11 pounds in just 9 days on this drug.  That's a plus but the benefit of having no appetite makes me have to force myself to eat. The nausea, at least for me, is minimal if at all.  I started out at 0.6 for 1 week and have been on the 1.2 for 3 days now.  I think it is a great drug that minimizes stomach upset.  Was on Metformin and had constant stomach/bowel issues.   The warning about the pancreatitis for those with high tryglicerides kind of spooked me but I talked with my doctor and he said it was a minimal risk.  I read the clinical trials as well.  I would recommend this to anyone who is pre-diabetic or type 2.
I have been on so many different medications and this is the first one that has truly worked for me.  I am so happy to finally have my diabetes under control.
lower my blood sugar level by 100 points

Have been on Victoza since 9/25/10. At the 1.8 dosage for about 3 mos. Doing great. A1C was 6.2. Dr very pleased. Have lost 34 lbs since starting. Still helps w/appetite control, but not like at first. Even so, am definitely making better decisions on my own.

Was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes in 2004, and while Metformin worked at first, it gradually became less effective.  Dr. added Glucotrol, and upped the Metformin dose, and I did my best with diet and exercise, but my numbers just went up and up.  Finally went to see an endocrinologist who put me on Victoza.  Have had no noticeable side effects, and my fasting blood glucose went from 276 to 92 in a month.  A1c is down 1.5 points in that same time period.  My BG numbers are now always well within the normal range and I'm losing weight.  Don't love the injections, but it's not hard or painful, and the result is totally worth it!

I've been on BP meds, chol. meds for years, always been heavy. Had bariatric surgery 11 years ago and gained all 110 lbs back +. All joints ached. Miserable. Diagnosed w/ type II diabetes 2 years ago but did nothing about it until 3 months ago (other than Metformin). Started Victoza and it is like a lifeline for me! Minor nausea for first week but that's all. All readings have come way down, no more pain, no more swelling in legs/feet. But best news is 45 lb. weight loss. Increased from lowest to highest setting in 1 week. Not hungry, no more "grazing" which is my downfall normally, happy and hopeful for first time in LONG time. Only trouble is I can't afford the drug as my insurance won't cover it. Dr. has stopped giving me samples. I'm out of Victoza and now devastated. Talk about "dangling the carrot!" Make slightly too much for medical aid. Give me something that finally works then take it away due to outrageous costs. Victoza drug rep tried to help but my insurance wouldn't budge on it. Help!

I am a type 2 diabetic and I was on Metformin. I was having some complications with it so I stopped taking it. Well, I found a new doctor and she placed me on this medicine. It has been wonderfull! I dont eat as much, I feel full faster, and my BS level is staying down. I am not a fan of shots, but this is so easy that I can do it myself. I am starting to have some trouble with my feet hurting though. Does anyone else have this problem?

I have been taking Victoza for 6 months.  At first I had headaches, was nausas, heart burn,constipation...it took about 2 months of backing down and slowly increasing again on the dosage and taking it in the evening.... to level out. I also had flu like symptoms and was so tired all the time. I lost 13 lbs. initially in 2 weeks and put 3lbs. back on. My blood sugar levels are better than they have been in years. I am so happy with Victoza, it was worth the rough time I went thru at first. Now I have started weight Watchers to take more lbs. off. My enery level is up and I am working out or walking every day. LIFE IS GOOD! Thank you Victoza!!
I have just started taking the 1.2mg injection. Three hour later, before lunch my BS reading was 265. Does anyone know how long it takes for Victoza to start lowering BS levels?

I have been on Victoza for 2 weeks and I love it. My BS is actually normal now. I am still on oral meds and insulin. I have had some ill effects, like constipation, gas, bloating, nausea and headache but they seem to have disappeared now. I am now on the 1.8mg dose. I have lost a few pounds. My appetite has decreased which helps with weight and sugar control. I am keeping an eye out for serious complication(which can happen with ANY drug). I am very satisfied with Victoza
I like the med. but have a problem with nausea and vomitting.

I take 1.2 micrograms of Victoza along with 500mg metformin bid. This drug is pretty much amazing. I've been on it for about two weeks and my BG levels are way down. Was averaging about 250 fasting and am now down to low 100s fasting. I've also lost about 6lbs already. The needle is so small that you barely feel it. I prefer this drug to Byetta. I am so grateful for this medication.
it took my blood sugar from 190 to 75
Really brought my readings into normal range.  Had a severe breathing reaction after increase to 10mg.  I thought I was having a heart attack.  Went to the emerg. room.  told to stop taking victosa.
This shot has worked for me along with Advandia (I know the reports on this and I am not having any problems been on Advandia for years) ~ It's easy to take with no pain or side effects!!
drug interactions WITH pain medicines caused bad rashes
Have been on Victoza for 2 1/2 months with no side effects. I have lost so far 35lbs. but now at a standstill. So far my numbers are good. Am very pleased with the drug I take 1.8 each day

I have been on this medication for 6 months without experiencing any serious side effects. Initially, I had some nausea, but once I regulated the dose, it's been fine. I take it along with one tablespoon of flaxseed oil which has significantly dropped my levels and my AC1. If you want to take a natural alternative along with med, get your doc's permission first. I just wish the med was less costly, but so far worth it.

Started on Victoza a little over a week ago.  First day, I took my Vicodin for my joint pain and was sick as a dog.  Never been so sick in all my life.  Throwing up on average every 2 minutes for 2 1/2 hours straight.  Then, was fine till a week later when I took my Vicodin again.  Also sick.  I blamed it on the Victoza, but I think it's the combo.  My numbers are incredible.  Went from morning fasting of around 250 to about 140 on the .06 dose.  Am still taking metformin and glymiperide.  Am going to tritrate up to the 1.2 gently over the next week, but may have to cut the glimperide down.  Weight loss: 5 lbs. but could be due to vomiting and diarrhea.  Love this drug though.

Have been on Victoza for two months. Started on 0.6 and moved up to 1.2 two weeks later. Initial nausea has subsided. My sugar levels are way down, I am losing weight and have stopped my nightly insulin injections. Still take 2000 mg of metformin daily. After all the other drugs I have been on, this is the only one that has worked and I am quite happy with it.

I've been taking Victoza for just over a week.  No luck with oral medications.  Instant positive results with Victoza.  Initially, I had nausea, but that improved on a daily basis.  I'm not constantly hungry, so I can see weight loss in my future.  I will be increasing the dose to 1.2 mg within the next week, and remain optimistic that I can deal with any side effects that might accompany the increased dose.  Victoza has been an eye opener for me.  2 or 3 days of use showed me that being more and more restrictive in my diet was not going to help my oral meds lower my blood sugar.  I am just so happy with the results I've experienced so far with Victoza.  I feel like the hands of time have been turned back for my health!!!!
Lost weight the first 2 months, am now at a plateau it seems. No side effects.
